thread.title: Inside gov's Springsteen fanboy obsession | The Christie Tracker Podcast
thread.title_full: Inside gov's Springsteen fanboy obsession | The Christie Tracker Podcast

author: WNYC
title: Inside gov's Springsteen fanboy obsession | The Christie Tracker Podcast
text:
WNYC By WNYC The Star-Ledger on October 14, 2015 at 10:57 AM, updated October 14, 2015 at 12:18 PM 
To understand Gov. Chris Christie you need to consider his Bruce Springsteen obsession. 
Come on, the man has been to over 130 Bruce shows. 
This week, the "Christie Tracker Podcast" looks at Christie, the Springsteen super fan â€“ who follows Bruce to shows, writes about him on message boards and trades tapes with fellow fans. 
WNYC/New Jersey Public Radio's Matt Katz guides us through Christie's life of worship at the Church of Springsteen and explains why messages posted 15 years ago shed light on the governor's personality today . 
We ponder how Christie could be so attracted to the musical messages of a political polar opposite. And speaking with host David Furst , Katz explains why he finds the old posts endearing. 
As he puts it, "This is a total geek, geeking out with other geeks." 
Listen to Katz describe how Jon Corzine, when he was governor, left an intimate Springsteen fundraiser show in which he performed "Born to Run" in its entirety. Christie was also in attendance: Christie "ended up looking into it later to confirm, indeed, there was no emergency." 
Is this what made Christie run against Corzine? 
RELATED: Christie says he's no longer Springsteen's friend 
Also: 
Christie was back in the state with the country's first primary last week. He held several town hall meetings in New Hampshire and some polls suggest he may be starting to gain a little traction there. 
Scott Conroy , senior political reporter with the Huffington Post joins us to wrap up the week. 

Check out the WNYC Data News App: The Christie Tracker .
